corner.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the point at which two lines or edges meet
corner.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He pulled a dirty handkerchief out by its corner and waved it at me.
Their initials were sewn on the corner of every pillow.
The TV station’s name appears in the corner of the screen.
Jessie sat on the corner of her bed.
corner.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the point where two roads meet
corner.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: kids hanging around on street corners
Ruth walked with her as far as the corner of the road.
The hotel is on the corner of 5th and Maine.
Several women were standing at the corner, talking to two police officers.
corner.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a point in a road where it turns sharply
corner.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: He had tried to take the corner too quickly, and had lost control of the car.
The petrol station is around the corner.
corner.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the place inside a room or box where two walls or sides meet
corner.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: I reserved a corner table in my favourite restaurant.
There was an old piano in the corner of the living room.
corner.translation[0].definitions[4].def: the sides of your mouth or eyes
corner.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: A tear appeared in the corner of his eye.
corner.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a difficult situation that you cannot easily escape from
corner.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: The writers have painted themselves into a corner by killing off all the most popular characters in the first series.
He found himself in a tight corner (=a very difficult situation) looking for a way to get out.
Don’t let your enemies back you into a corner.
corner.translation[0].definitions[6].def: a kick or hit that one team is allowed to take from one of the corners of their opponent’s end of the field
corner.translation[0].definitions[7].def: any of the four corners of the area in which the competitors fight in boxing or wrestling, especially one of the two corners where the competitors go in between rounds
corner.translation[0].definitions[8].def: a distant place in another part of the world
corner.translation[0].definitions[8].exa: People came from the four corners of the world (=from lots of different places) to make America their new home.
She’s gone off to work in some remote corner of the world.
corner.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 1: the point at which two lines or edges meet
corner.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: The ball flew straight into the top corner of the net.
We followed the path to the left-hand corner of the field.
Put your address in the top right-hand corner of the page.
the southeast/northwest etc corner of something
I was staying in the southwest corner of the island.
Each team was based in one of the four corners of the pool.
Something was moving in the far right corner of the garden.
He sat on his own in a quiet corner of the library.
Plant the herbs in a shady corner of the garden.
corner.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: Go slowly because there’s a sharp corner up ahead.
The car had come speeding around a blind corner much too fast.
There’s a newspaper shop on the street corner.
I walked on and turned the corner into Church Road.
At that moment, a police car came around the corner.
A tall good-looking man rounded the corner.
He took the corner too fast and crashed into a tree.
We watched the two boys disappear around the corner.
I crashed into a motorcyclist who had cut the corner.
She stood on the corner saying goodnight to Michael.
corner.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to force a person or animal into a position from which they cannot easily escape
corner.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Once the dog was cornered, he began to growl.
corner.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to go to someone who is trying to avoid you, and make them listen to you
corner.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Later, he cornered Jenny on the stairs and asked her what was wrong.
corner.translation[1].definitions[2].def: if a car corners, it goes around a corner or bend in the road
corner.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to gain control of the whole supply of a particular type of goods or services
corner.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Singapore has made significant efforts to corner the market in this type of specialised service company.
